Generation V.Black: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
Generation V.White: It immediately headbutts anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is massively thick.
Generation V.Black 2: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.
Generation V.White 2: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.

Generation VI.X: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
Generation VI.Y: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: They move in small groups, walking around lazily. Anyone who makes eye contact gets smacked with a headbutt.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. The saggier their skin, the more respect they garner.

Generation VIII.Sword: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.
Generation VIII.Shield: It protects itself with its durable skin. It's thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. Among Scraggy, individuals with saggier skin apparently garner more respect.
Generation IX.Violet: It will abruptly headbutt anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is extremely hard.

Generation V.Black: Routes 4 and 18 , Desert Resort , P2 Laboratory Route 1 ( dark grass )
Generation V.White: Routes 4 and 18 , Desert Resort , P2 Laboratory Route 1 ( dark grass )
Generation V.Black 2: Route 4 and Desert Resort Desert Resort ( N's Pokémon )
Generation V.White 2: Route 4 and Desert Resort Desert Resort ( N's Pokémon )

Generation VIII.Sword: Galar Mine No. 2 , Motostoke Outskirts , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , Dusty Bowl , Giant's Cap , Giant's Mirror Rolling Fields , West Lake Axewell , South Lake Miloch , North Lake Miloch , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Sword Expansion Pass: Challenge Road , Potbottom Desert Soothing Wetlands ( Wanderer )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Canyon Biome , Chargestone Cavern Tera Raid Battles ( 1★ )
